include/freebus-atmega16.h File Reference

Hardware specific options for the ATmega168P. DO NOT INCLUDE THAT FILE DIRECTLY, include fb_hardware.h instead. More...

#include <inttypes.h>
#include <avr/io.h>
#include <avr/eeprom.h>
#include <avr/pgmspace.h>
#include <avr/interrupt.h>
#include <avr/wdt.h>
#include <avr/sleep.h>
#include <util/parity.h>
#include <util/delay.h>
#include <string.h>

Defines

#define ENABLE_ALL_INTERRUPTS()   sei()
 < is defined if target system is the ATMega168
#define DISABLE_IRQS   unsigned char _sreg = SREG; cli();
 Disable IRQs, save status before doing this.
#define ENABLE_IRQS   { if(_sreg & 0x80) sei(); }
 Enable IRQs if they are enabled before DISABLE_IRQS is called.
#define CONFIGURE_INT0()
 Configure external INT0 to match falling edge and enable the interrupt.
#define DISABLE_RX_INT()
 disable interrupt INT0
#define ENABLE_RX_INT()
 clear pending interrupts INT0 and enable interrupt
#define RELOAD_TIMER0(value, tccr0)
 Reload Timer0 calculate value with: (F_CPU*TIME_TO_WAIT)/prescaler substract from 0xFF (or decimal 255), that's the value you want, keep in mind it must be a 8-bit value, adapt the prescaler if necessary note substract 8µs from value! (that the microcontroller eats every time).
#define TIMER1_OVERRUN   (TIFR & (1<<OCF1A))
 Checkcondition for application timer overrun.
#define CLEAR_TIMER1_OVERRUN   TIFR |= OCF1A
 Clear overrun bit set for application timer.
#define RELOAD_APPLICATION_TIMER()
 Reload the application timer (Timer1) to start from 0.
#define ENABLE_PWM(x)
 Enable PWM, PWM pin (PB3) is set by hardware.
#define DISABLE_PWM()
 Disable PWM and set PWM pin to high.
#define ENABLE_UART_TX_IRQ()
 Enable interrupt for UART0.
#define DISABLE_UART_TX_IRQ()
 Disable interrupt for UART0.
#define UART_SEND_BYTE(tx_char)
 Store one byte in UART0 send buffer.
#define ENABLE_WATCHDOG(x)
 Enable internal hardware watchdog.
#define DISABLE_WATCHDOG()
 Disable internal hardware watchdog.

Detailed Description

Hardware specific options for the ATmega168P. DO NOT INCLUDE THAT FILE DIRECTLY, include fb_hardware.h instead.

Author:
Matthias Fechner, Christian Bode
Date:
Fri Mar 20 08:40:56 2009

Define Documentation

#define CLEAR_TIMER1_OVERRUN   TIFR |= OCF1A

Clear overrun bit set for application timer.

Referenced by main().

 
#define CONFIGURE_INT0 (  ) 
Value:
{        \
          MCUCR |= (1U<ISC01);    \
          MCUCR &= ~(1U<ISC00);   \
          GICR  |= (1U<<INT0);    \
     }

Configure external INT0 to match falling edge and enable the interrupt.

Referenced by fbhal_Init().

data direction byte of CTRL pin

bit position of CTRL pin

output port (byte) of CTRL pin

#define DISABLE_IRQS   unsigned char _sreg = SREG; cli();

Disable IRQs, save status before doing this.

Referenced by AllocMsg(), AppendToQueue(), dequeuemsg(), queuemsg(), and timerOverflowFunction().

 
#define DISABLE_PWM (  ) 
Value:
{                                   \
          TCCR2 &= ~((1<<COM21)|(1<<COM20));   /* disable PWM pin  */   \
          SETPIN_CTRL(ON);                     /* set port to high */   \
     }

Disable PWM and set PWM pin to high.

 
#define DISABLE_RX_INT (  ) 
Value:
{           \
          GICR &= ~(1U<<INT0);                  \
     }

disable interrupt INT0

Referenced by timer_timeout().

 
#define DISABLE_UART_TX_IRQ (  ) 
Value:
{                                 \
          UCSR0B &= ~(1<<TXCIE0); /* disable transmit IRQ */          \
     }

Disable interrupt for UART0.

Referenced by ISR().

 
#define DISABLE_WATCHDOG (  ) 
Value:
{           \
          MCUCSR = 0;                           \
          wdt_disable();                        \
     }

Disable internal hardware watchdog.

Referenced by main().

#define ENABLE_IRQS   { if(_sreg & 0x80) sei(); }

Enable IRQs if they are enabled before DISABLE_IRQS is called.

Referenced by AllocMsg(), AppendToQueue(), dequeuemsg(), queuemsg(), and timerOverflowFunction().

#define ENABLE_PWM ( x   ) 
Value:
{                                   \
          TCCR2 = (1<<WGM20)|(1<<COM21)|(1<<COM20)|(1<<CS21); /* set to PWM mode and enable OC2 pin, prescaler 8 */ \
          TCNT2 = 0;              /* reset timer2 */                    \
          OCR2  = (x);            /* defines the duty cycle */          \
     }

Enable PWM, PWM pin (PB3) is set by hardware.

Parameters:
x Duty-cycle (0xF2=6,3%, 0x01=100%)

Referenced by restartApplication(), switchObjects(), and timerOverflowFunction().

 
#define ENABLE_RX_INT (  ) 
Value:
{           \
          GIFR |= (1U<<INTF0);                  \
          GICR |= (1U<<INT0);                   \
     }

clear pending interrupts INT0 and enable interrupt

Referenced by ISR(), timer_rec_chars(), and tx_wait_ack().

 
#define ENABLE_UART_TX_IRQ (  ) 
Value:
{                            \
          UCSR0B |= (1<<TXCIE0);  /* enable transmit IRQ */      \
     }

Enable interrupt for UART0.

Referenced by trigger_uart().

#define ENABLE_WATCHDOG ( x   ) 
Value:
{           \
          wdt_enable(x);                        \
     }

Enable internal hardware watchdog.

Referenced by fb_hal_restart().

#define RELOAD_APPLICATION_TIMER (  ) 
Value:
{                                   \
          TCCR1A = 0;             /* CTC (Clear Timer on Compate match) */ \
          TCCR1B = (1<<WGM12)|(1<<CS11)|(1<<CS10); /* CTC-mode, prescale to 64 */ \
          OCR1A  = 16249;         /* every 130 ms OCR1A=(delay*F_CPU)/(prescaler)-1 */ \
          TCNT1  = 0;             /* reset timer */                     \
     }

Reload the application timer (Timer1) to start from 0.

Referenced by restartApplication().

#define RELOAD_TIMER0 ( value,
tccr0   ) 
Value:
{                                   \
          TCCR0 = 0;             /* stop timer */                       \
          TCNT0 = value;         /* set start of timer, run to 0xFF */  \
          TIMSK |= (1<<TOIE0);   /* enable overflow interrupt */        \
          TCCR0 = tccr0;         /* set mode and reenable timer */      \
     }

Reload Timer0 calculate value with: (F_CPU*TIME_TO_WAIT)/prescaler substract from 0xFF (or decimal 255), that's the value you want, keep in mind it must be a 8-bit value, adapt the prescaler if necessary note substract 8µs from value! (that the microcontroller eats every time).

{           \
          UDR0 =(uint8_t)(tx_char);             \
     }
